sentences.sentence: All day long he flew, and at night he arrived in the city.
“Where can I stay?” he asked himself.
“I hope I can find somewhere nice to sleep.”
It was then that he saw the statue( 雕像 ) of the Happy Prince( 王子 ).
“I will stay there,” he said.
“It is a good place, with plenty of fresh air.”
So he landed just between the feet of the Happy Prince( 王子 ).
“I have a golden bedroom,” he said softly to himself as he looked around.
He prepared to go to sleep,
but just as he was putting his head under his wing, a large drop of water fell on him.
“What a strange thing!” he said.
“There is not a single cloud in the sky, and the stars are quite clear and bright, and yet it is raining.
The weather in the north of Europe is really awful.
The Reed( 芦苇 ) used to like the rain, but that was only because she was selfish( 自私的 ).”
Then another drop fell.
“What is the use of a statue( 雕像 ) if it cannot keep the rain off me?” he said.
“I must look for a better place to stay,” and he decided to fly away.
But before he had opened his wings, a third drop fell.
When he looked up, he saw—Ah! What did he see?
The eyes of the Happy Prince( 王子 ) were filled with( 充满 ) tears( 眼泪 ),
and tears( 眼泪 ) were running down his golden face.
His face was so beautiful in the moonlight that the little Swallow( 燕子 ) was filled with( 充满 ) pity.
“Who are you?” he said.
“I am the Happy Prince( 王子 ).”
“Why are you crying then?” asked the Swallow( 燕子 ). “You are getting me wet.”
“When I was alive and had a human heart, I did not know what tears( 眼泪 ) were,” answered the statue( 雕像 ).
“Back then I lived in the palace, where sadness is not allowed to enter.
In the daytime I played with my friends in the garden, and in the evening we danced in the Great Hall.
All around the garden there was a very high wall, but I never cared to ask what was beyond it,
because everything around me was so beautiful.
My friends all called me the Happy Prince( 王子 ),
and indeed I was very happy, if pleasure is happiness.
So I lived, and so I died.
And now that I am dead, they have put me up here so high that I can see all the ugliness and all the sadness of my city.
Even though my heart is made of iron, I cannot stop myself from crying.”
“Is he not made of gold on the inside as well?” said the Swallow( 燕子 ) to himself.
He was too polite to ask the Prince( 王子 ) directly.
The Prince( 王子 ) continued speaking.
“Far, far away, there is a poor house in a little street.
One of the windows is open, and through it I can see a woman sitting at a table.
Her face looks old and tired, and her hands are rough( 粗糙的 ) and red from sewing( 做针线活 ) all day long.
She is sewing( 缝制 ) a beautiful dress for the Queen’s next dance.
In the corner of the room, her little boy is lying sick in bed.
He has a fever, and is asking for oranges.
His mother has nothing to give him but river water, so he is crying.
Swallow( 燕子 ), Swallow( 燕子 ), little Swallow( 燕子 ), will you please bring her the ruby( 红宝石 ) from my sword( 宝剑 )?
My feet are nailed( 被固定 ) to this column( 柱子 ) and I cannot move.”
“I have friends waiting for me in Egypt( 埃及，地名 ),” said the Swallow( 燕子 ).
“They are flying up and down the Nile River,
and they will all be expecting me to meet them there soon.”
“Swallow( 燕子 ), Swallow( 燕子 ), little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ),
“will you please stay with me for one more night, and take my ruby( 红宝石 ) to the woman?
The boy is so thirsty, and his mother is so sad.”
“I don’t think I like boys,” answered the Swallow( 燕子 ).
“Last summer, when I was staying on the river, there were two boys there.
They were very rude( 无礼的 ), and were always throwing stones at me.
They never hit me, of course, because I was too fast for them.
Still, it was a very rude( 无礼的 ) thing for them to do.”
But the Happy Prince( 王子 ) looked so sad that the little Swallow( 燕子 ) felt sorry for him.
“It is very cold here,” he said.
“Still, I will stay with you for one night, and bring your ruby( 红宝石 ) to the woman.”
“Thank you, little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ).
So the Swallow( 燕子 ) pulled out( 取出 ) the great ruby( 红宝石 ) from the Prince( 王子 )’s sword( 宝剑 ), and flew away with it in his beak( 鸟喙 ) over the roofs( 房顶 ) of the town.

question.cn: 为什么会有一些水滴掉落到燕子的身上？
question.en: Why there were some drops of water falling on the Swallow?

analysis: 文中提到：“When he looked up. . . the eyes of the Happy Prince were filled with tears, and tears were running down his golden face.”快乐王子的雕像在哭泣，眼泪流下来掉落到了燕子的身上，因此选C。

question.cn: 快乐王子为什么会哭泣呢？
question.en: Why did the Happy Prince cry?

options.cn: 看到自己城市里发生的不幸，他很难过。
options.en: He felt sad to see these misfortunes happen in his city.

options.cn: 他被燕子的故事感动了。
options.en: He was moved by the story of the Swallow.

analysis: 文中提到：“And now that. . . that I can see all the ugliness and all the sadness of my city. Even though my heart is made of iron, I cannot stop myself from crying.”看到城市里的所有苦难，快乐王子很难过，因此选A。

question.cn: 在破旧的房子里的女人正在做什么？
question.en: What was the woman in the poor house doing?

options.en: She was cooking for her sick son.

analysis: 文中提到：“There is a poor house. . . she is sewing a beautiful dress for the Queen's next dance.”女人正在缝制舞会衣服，因此选C。

question.cn: 快乐王子为什么不亲自把宝石送给那个贫穷的女人？
question.en: Why didn't the Happy Prince bring the poor woman his ruby by himself?

options.cn: 快乐王子已经失去了自己的双腿。

analysis: 文中提到：“My feet are nailed to this column and I cannot move.”快乐王子的脚被钉在柱子上，王子无法自己移动，因此选B。
